page.title: 01LANDSCAPE..SETTLEMENT
page.content: This D-Block lies to the North of the market town of Cupar, Fife. It is an area of gently rolling countryside, the majority of which is farmed as intensively managed grainland. The highest point of this area is 173 metres at Myrecairnie Hill. About 1/3 of our block contains crops other than grass, including soft fruits, barley and oilseed rape. Throughout the area there are scattered patches of woodland which is mainly deciduous, a small proportion of which is owne by the Forestry Commission. Overall, woodland makes up about 8% of the total area. A small stream meanders gently through the South of this area. The settlement of pattern is typically rural, incorporating large farms and cottages, each quite a distance from the next. There are 11 seperate farms in the area/no villages
